questions.question_text:
A customer has two sub-organizations with different domains with separate AD servers. Both Domain Controllers and Cloud Connector are in the same subnet.
The first sub-organization is currently set up to manage devices in Workspace One UEM using Cloud Connector and a VMware Identity Manager.
What is the VMware recommendation to set up the second sub-organization that is not set up for management with Workspace One UEM?

choices.A: Use the same Cloud Connector server and set up directory services and request an additional Identity Management Tenant
choices.C: Deploy an additional Cloud Connector Server and set up Directory services and then use the Identity Manager Tenant currently available
choices.B: Deploy Use an additional Cloud Connector server and set up directory services server and request additional Identity Management Tenant
choices.D: Use the same Cloud Connector server to set up directory services and the same Identity management tenant

discussion.content: C is true, as it is not stated that the domains are in a trust.

questions.question_text:
An administrator is planning a SaaS Workspace ONE deployment that will include integration of an existing on-premises Citrix environment.
Which two components are required to integrate the Citrix resources? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
C and D
From the student Lecture Manual p657
Content can only be assigned to OGs or user groups. a smart group is not a valid assignment group for the content assignment.

comments.content: I couldn't find any documentation refering to "managed content" specifically and smart groups. I seems to be related more to applications.

discussion.content:
Both A & C or A& D are correct based on the link and notes below

https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-Workspace-ONE-UEM/services/UEM_ConsoleBasics/GUID-AWT-ASSIGNMENTGROUPSOVERVIEW.html 

Assignment Groups is an umbrella term used to categorize certain management grouping structures within Workspace ONE UEM powered by AirWatch. Organization Groups, Smart Groups, and User Groups each have full feature sets and are distinct from each other.

One feature these groups have in common is the way they can be used to assign content to user devices easily. Assignment Groups enables an administrator to manage these three grouping structures from a single location.

questions.question_text: Which two ways can managed content be assigned to users? (Choose two.)

choices.C: Workspace ONE UEM API is not configured in the Workspace ONE Intelligence portal
choices.B: Workspace ONE Intelligence is not integrated with the administrator's account
choices.A: VMware Identity Manager environment is not setup in the Workspace ONE Intelligence portal
choices.D: The administrator tried to access Workspace ONE Intelligence from a Container type Organization Group

questions.question_text:
An administrator would like to access the Workspace ONE Intelligence portal, however, the administrator does not see Intelligence under Monitor.
Which could be causing the issue?

choices.A: Manual install to a Linux Server
choices.C: Powershell install to a Windows Server
choices.B: Manual install to a Windows Server

questions.question_text: Which method can an administrator use to deploy the VMware Unified Access Gateway (UAG) appliance for use as a Workspace ONE VMware Tunnel?
